editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.note: At the head of fol. i ‘Doctor de Media uille’, s. xiv.
A table of quaestiones in an anglicana hand, s. xiv, begins on fol. 1v, finishing on 1r.

msItem.author: RICHARD MIDDLETON OFM
msItem.title: Quaestiones XLV Disputatae
msItem.incipit: (Running head Pars prima.) Queritur utrum Deus sit summe simplex
msItem.explicit: (fol. 115v; q. 37) et inuestigandi et intellectum excitandi.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt questiones prime partis fratris R.
msItem.incipit: (fol. 116; running head Pars II) Postquam quesitum est de Deo et angelis primo de angelis quantum ad eorum naturalia que communia sunt bonis et malis et postea de angelis malis
msItem.explicit: (fol. 156; q. 7) que autem de ista questione dicta sunt sine temeraria assercione dicta fuit. Explicit.
msItem.note: At the foot of fol. 116 is pencilled ‘Secunda pars questionum fratris R. de Mediauilla’.
Individual questions pr. and discussed in De Humanae Cognitionis Ratione Anecdota Quaedam (Quaracchi, 1883), pp. 221–48; Glorieux, Théol. 324c.

msItem.author: RICHARD MIDDLETON OFM
msItem.title: Quodlibeta I-III
msItem.incipit: In nostra disputacione de quolibet quedam fuerunt que sit de Deo et quedam de creaturis
msItem.explicit: et obscura explanata prout scirem et possem
msItem.note: At the foot of fol. 162 is pencilled ‘Primum quodlibet fratris Ricardi de Media uilla de ordine fratrum minorum’ and ‘De quolibet R. 17 pecie’. Another hand has written ‘tria quodlibet fratris R. de Meneuile’.

Fols. 221–3v blank except for fol. 221v which is covered with early pencil-notes, effaced at the beginning, apparently a quaestio (sections begin ‘Dico breuiter quod ...’). Faint words in stylus on fol. 222.

supportDesc.extent:
225 leaves (i + 223, incl. 14A) 300 205
230 140
The edges savagely retrimmed, with loss of running heads and marginalia, and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: A bifolium at each end, 1–912, 108, 11–1312, 1410, 15–1912; catchwords, red leaf-numbers.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 43 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Proficient English gothic rotunda bookhands of university type.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red and blue flourished initials; blue initials flourished in red; red or blue paraphs; running heads in the colours.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, sewn on six bands; formerly chained from the usual position. The outermost leaves were pastedowns in an earlier binding. On fol. i are marks of two straps, with nails of both brass and iron.

history.provenance: At the head of fol. 223v, in the same hand as the inscription on fol. i, is ‘Liber Willelmi de Haryngtone ex empt’ prec’ x. s. In quo continentur 47 Quodlibete Ricardi de Media uille de 3 de ’. Harington (BRUO 874) was fellow 1320–1 until 1335, d. by Aug. 1349.
At the foot of fol. 1v, in the usual hand (see above, MS 69), is ‘Liber collegii ex dono Magistri Thome Bloxham’. For Bloxham, fellow c. 1449–61, see MS 41.
On fol. iv is ‘B lier .7.us’, in the usual hand (see above, MS 60), and a table of contents, s. xv. ‘11’ is inked on the foredge.
Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with ‘D. 8, 6’ (canc.) and a title, s. xvii, ‘O. 3. 11. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘L. 1. 10 (CXXXIX)’ in red; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
